Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
mannequin \mannequin\ n. 1. a woman who wears clothes to display fashions; a fashion model. [WordNet sense 1]
Syn: fashion model, model. [WordNet 1.5]
2. A three-dimensional model of a person, used to display clothes, especially in retail stores and in window displays; a dummy. [WordNet sense 2]
Syn: manikin, mannikin, manakin. [WordNet 1.5]
3. A model of a human form used by tailors to help make clothing of the proper shape. [PJC]

mannequin n 1: a woman who wears clothes to display fashions; "she was too fat to be a mannequin" [syn: {manikin}, {mannikin}, {manakin}, {fashion model}, {model}] 2: a life-size dummy used to display clothes [syn: {manikin}, {mannikin}, {manakin}, {form}]
